extends XhiveExceptionBase

INVALID_PARAMETER

See Also:
Constant Field Values

LOCK_NOT_GRANTED

public static final int LOCK_NOT_GRANTED
You're trying to obtain a lock on an object which is already locked by another session. Wait for the other session to release its lock before trying to obtain a lock again.

Can be the result of a dead-lock situation, or when the wait-mode of the session is something other than WAIT and an object is locked by another session.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

public static final int ACCESS_DENIED
You don't have the correct access level for this object (query or document) Check the XhiveAuthorityIf interface to see your access rights

Constant Field Values

OBJECT_DEAD

public static final int OBJECT_DEAD
You're trying an operation on a dead object. A dead object is an object that has been deleted.

public static final int INVALID_USE
Invalid use occurs, for instance if a superuser is trying to perform an administrators operation.

NAME_ALREADY_EXISTS

public static final int NAME_ALREADY_EXISTS
Documents, Schema's, XhiveQueryContexts, XhiveQueries, XhiveQueryResults NamespaceDeclarations and Variablebindings need a unique name when given. Change the name to a unique one.

Constant Field Values

OBJECT_CLOSED

public static final int OBJECT_CLOSED
You tried to use an object that can only be used within the scope of the transaction in which it was created. After the transaction is closed (commit,checkpoint or rollback is called), the object can not be used anymore.

NO_TRANSACTION_ACTIVE

public static final int NO_TRANSACTION_ACTIVE

Constant Field Values

CURRENT_THREAD_NOT_JOINED

public static final int CURRENT_THREAD_NOT_JOINED
Current thread is not joined. A transaction has to be bound to a specific thread. If you create a transaction in another thread use XhiveSessionIf.join() to join the transaction to the current thread

See Also:
Constant Field Values

DATABASE_NOT_FOUND

public static final int DATABASE_NOT_FOUND

See Also:
Constant Field Values

FEDERATION_NOT_FOUND

public static final int FEDERATION_NOT_FOUND
Federation can't be found. Is the xhive bootstrap variable correct ? This bootstrap variable is supplied to the jvm by a system variable, or by an argument to getDriver().

See Also:
Constant Field Values

INCORRECT_FEDERATION_SCHEMA

public static final int INCORRECT_FEDERATION_SCHEMA
The schema of the federation this jar needs to operate on is invalid for this jar. This can mean two things:
  • you are using a new version of X-Hive on a federation created with an older version of X-Hive. In this case you need to run the conversion tool supplied with the new version.
  • you are using an old version of X-Hive on a federation created with a newer version of X-Hive. This is not allowed.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

AS_ACTIVATE_NOTYETADDED_MODEL

public static final int AS_ACTIVATE_NOTYETADDED_MODEL
Trying to activate a content model which is not added to a catalog (yet). You have to add a content model to a catalog before you may use it, otherwise there might be a inconsistent state at commit-time.
